content.prompt: Agriculture is practiced at the local scale, and agricultural yields are measured at the national scale. Which of the following best explains why the concept of the global system of agriculture is helpful to geographers?

choices.label: The concept is most useful for predicting local productivity and market changes.
The concept is the best way to map out the environmental effects of agricultural land use.
The concept is a way to help countries that have become highly dependent on an export commodity.
The concept helps geographers simplify and visualize a vast and complicated global supply chain.
The concept helps geographers be specific and consider every detail about global farming practices.

unit.text: 5: Agriculture and Rural Land-Use Patterns and Processes

skill.text: Skill 5.D: Explain the degree to which a geographic concept, process, model, or theory effectively explains geographic effects across various geographic scales.
